name: offshore platform production, petroleum | offshore platform, petroleum | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8799/documentation

Construction and dismantling of an offshore production platform with a weight of 2500t. Life time 15 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Materials for construction, energy use for erection. Land use and transformation. Disposal of the platform after use. Wells are not included and are considered separately. Manufacturing of facilities partly not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/30:Manufacture of other transport equipment/301:Building of ships and boats/3011:Building of ships and floating structures

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for materials based on information from 1990. New data for energy and material uses during construction.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Type of platform used in the North Sea.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mix of 80% steel and 20% concrete platforms.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Applied on all offshore operations. There might be differences depending on depth of sea.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Publication in environmental reports and other literature.
